A

AndGate - Class in <Unnamed>
Handles the properties specific to and gates.
AndGate(String, float) - Constructor for class AndGate
The constructor used only from within class Gate

C

checkSanity() - Method in class ConstGate
check the sanity of this gate's connections, also begins the simulation by scheduling output changes from false to true for wires connected to the true output
checkSanity() - Method in class Gate
check the sanity of this gate's connections by making sure that all of a Gate's input pins are in use or else the simulation can't run
checkSanity() - Method in class NotGate
check the sanity of this gate's connections, by ensuring that its input pin is in use by a wire also begins the simulation by scheduling changes for not gate outputs
checkSanity() - Method in class TwoInputGate
check the sanity of this gate's connections, by ensuring that all of its input pins are in use by a wire
ConstGate - Class in <Unnamed>
Handles the properties specific to const gates.
ConstGate(String, float) - Constructor for class ConstGate
The constructor used only from within class Gate
ConstructorFailure() - Constructor for exception Gate.ConstructorFailure
 

D

delay - Variable in class Gate
 

F

factory(Scanner) - Static method in class Gate
The public use this factory to construct gates

G

Gate - Class in <Unnamed>
Gates process inputs from Wires and deliver outputs to Wires, the top level Gate is a framework to create two input or Logic Gates
Gate(String, float) - Constructor for class Gate
Constructor used only from within subclasses of class Gate
Gate.ConstructorFailure - Exception in <Unnamed>
 

I

in1 - Variable in class TwoInputGate
 
in1used - Variable in class TwoInputGate
 
in2 - Variable in class TwoInputGate
 
in2used - Variable in class TwoInputGate
 
inPinName(int) - Method in class ConstGate
get the name of the input pin, given its number
inPinName(int) - Method in class Gate
get the name of the input pin, given its number, if a String n is a legal name of an input to a gate then that String can be found with n = g.inPinName( g.registerInput(w, n) ); This means that inPinName gets that name of the pin registered by registerInput
inPinName(int) - Method in class NotGate
get the name of the input pin, given its number
inPinName(int) - Method in class TwoInputGate
get the name of the input pin, given its number, if the number is valid
inputChangeEvent(float, int, boolean) - Method in class ConstGate
simulate the change of one of this gate's inputs, a call to this will cause a fatal error because const gates have no inputs
inputChangeEvent(float, int, boolean) - Method in class Gate
simulate the change of one of this gate's inputs
inputChangeEvent(float, int, boolean) - Method in class NotGate
simulate the change of one of this gate's inputs which causes a change to its output if the event isn't filtered out by the low pass filter
inputChangeEvent(float, int, boolean) - Method in class TwoInputGate
simulate the change of one of this gate's inputs, this will call update value for one of its subclasses which will handle simulating the result of an input change to one of its pins

L

LogicGate - Class in <Unnamed>
Gathers all of the properties common to single-output gates Specifically, all LogicGates drive a single list of output wires with a single output value when an OutputChangeEvent occurs.
LogicGate(String, float) - Constructor for class LogicGate
The constructor used only from subclasses of LogicGate

N

name - Variable in class Gate
 
NotGate - Class in <Unnamed>
Handles the properties specific to not gates.
NotGate(String, float) - Constructor for class NotGate
The constructor used only from within class Gate

O

OrGate - Class in <Unnamed>
Handles the properties specific to or gates.
OrGate(String, float) - Constructor for class OrGate
The constructor used only from within class Gate
outPinName(int) - Method in class ConstGate
get the name of the output pin, given its number
outPinName(int) - Method in class Gate
get the name of the output pin, given its number,that number must always be zero.
outPinName(int) - Method in class LogicGate
get the name of the output pin, given its number, if the pin number is correct
outputChangeEvent(float) - Method in class LogicGate
Simulate an output change on this wire Passes the new value to the input of the gate to which this wire goes.

R

registerInput(Wire, String) - Method in class ConstGate
tell the gate that one of its input pins is in use
registerInput(Wire, String) - Method in class Gate
tell the gate that one of its input pins is in use, in order to be created all of a Gate's input pins must be in use by a wire
registerInput(Wire, String) - Method in class NotGate
tell the gate that its input pin is in use, an input pin can only be used by at most one wire so if another wire tries to connect to its input pin there is an error
registerInput(Wire, String) - Method in class TwoInputGate
tell the gate that one of its input pins is in use
registerOutput(Wire, String) - Method in class ConstGate
tell the gate that one of its output pins is in use
registerOutput(Wire, String) - Method in class Gate
tell the gate that one of its output pins is in use an output pin can have any number of outgoing wires
registerOutput(Wire, String) - Method in class LogicGate
tell the gate that one of its output pins is in use

T

toString() - Method in class AndGate
reconstruct the textual description of this gate
toString() - Method in class ConstGate
reconstruct the textual description of this gate
toString() - Method in class NotGate
reconstruct the textual description of this gate
toString() - Method in class OrGate
reconstruct the textual description of this gate
TwoInputGate - Class in <Unnamed>
Handles the properties common to logic gates with two inputs Specifically, all two-input gates have two input wires, in1 an in2.
TwoInputGate(String, float) - Constructor for class TwoInputGate
The constructor used only from subclasses of TwoInputGate

U

updateValue(float) - Method in class AndGate
update the output value of a gate based on its input values and if a change in a pin's input value causes an ouput change then an output change event is scheduled which could be suppressed by the low pass filter
updateValue(float) - Method in class OrGate
update the output value of a gate based on its input values and if the input value changes then schedule an output change event which could be suppressed due to the low pass filter
updateValue(float) - Method in class TwoInputGate
update the output value of a gate based on its input values This is called from inputChangeEvent to delegate the response of the logic gate to the input change to the actual gate instead of this abstract class.

V

value - Variable in class LogicGate
